metadata.name: Architectural Heritage of Athens: A Journey Through Time
metadata.description: Explore the architectural evolution of Athens from classical antiquity to the Roman period through its most iconic structures.

points.name: Ancient Agora
points.description: The heart of ancient Athenian civic life and birthplace of democracy
points.inDepthDescription: The Ancient Agora represents the world's first purpose-built public square, embodying the democratic ideals of ancient Athens. The centerpiece Temple of Hephaestus stands as the best-preserved Doric temple, while the reconstructed Stoa of Attalos demonstrates everyday classical architecture.
points.inDepthDescriptionContext: The space served as the center of Athenian democracy and commerce, featuring various civic buildings, temples, and public spaces.
points.tips: Visit early morning to avoid crowds and capture the best photos of the Temple of Hephaestus
points.historicalContext: Served as the center of Athenian democracy from the 6th century BCE to the Roman period
points.culturalSignificance: Birthplace of democratic governance and public discourse
points.hiddenGems: Ancient ballot boxes (ostraka) in the Agora Museum
points.historicalNarrative: The Agora evolved from a simple marketplace to the heart of Athenian democracy, where philosophers like Socrates engaged in public discourse

nextStop.description: Head up towards the Acropolis entrance

points.name: Acropolis Approach - Propylaea
points.inDepthDescription: The Propylaea represents one of ancient Greece's most sophisticated engineering achievements, creating a dramatic transition from the mortal world to the sacred precinct above.
points.inDepthDescriptionContext: Built during the Golden Age of Athens under Pericles
points.tips: Watch your footing on the marble steps â€“ they're polished smooth by millions of footsteps
points.accessibility: Challenging - steep incline and marble steps
points.historicalContext: Built 437-432 BCE as part of Pericles' building program
points.hiddenGems: Ancient visitor graffiti on marble steps
points.historicalNarrative: Designed by Mnesicles to create a magnificent entrance worthy of the Acropolis

points.name: Parthenon
points.description: The crown jewel of Classical Greek architecture
points.inDepthDescription: The ultimate expression of Doric architecture, featuring sophisticated optical refinements and perfect proportions following the golden ratio.
points.inDepthDescriptionContext: Built during the height of Athenian power and influence
points.tips: Visit during golden hour for best photography
points.accessibility: Moderate - viewing from designated areas only
points.historicalContext: Built 447-432 BCE as the centerpiece of Pericles' building program
points.culturalSignificance: Symbol of Classical Greek civilization and democracy
points.hiddenGems: Traces of original paint on architectural details
points.historicalNarrative: Created as a testament to Athenian power and artistic achievement

points.name: Erechtheion
points.description: Innovative asymmetrical temple with the famous Caryatid Porch
points.inDepthDescription: A masterpiece of asymmetrical design accommodating multiple shrines on uneven ground, featuring the iconic Caryatid Porch.
points.inDepthDescriptionContext: Built to house multiple important religious shrines
points.tips: Study the building from all angles to appreciate its complex design
points.historicalContext: Built 421-406 BCE during the Peloponnesian War
points.culturalSignificance: Innovative architectural solution to complex religious requirements
points.hiddenGems: Unique north porch with asymmetrical spacing
points.historicalNarrative: Created to honor multiple deities and legendary kings

nextStop.description: Descend to the Temple of Olympian Zeus

points.name: Temple of Olympian Zeus
points.description: Colossal temple showing Roman influence on Greek architecture
points.inDepthDescription: One of the ancient world's largest temples, demonstrating the synthesis of Greek and Roman architectural traditions.
points.inDepthDescriptionContext: Construction spanned multiple empires over 638 years
points.tips: Visit early morning or late afternoon for dramatic lighting
points.historicalContext: Completed by Emperor Hadrian in 132 CE
points.culturalSignificance: Symbol of Roman influence on Greek architecture
points.historicalNarrative: The temple's construction history mirrors Athens' political transitions

points.name: Hadrian's Library
points.description: Roman cultural complex synthesizing Greek and Roman styles
points.inDepthDescription: A sophisticated cultural center combining Greek architectural elements with Roman building techniques.
points.inDepthDescriptionContext: Served as both library and educational institution
points.tips: Less crowded than other sites - good for peaceful contemplation
points.historicalContext: Built in 132 CE as part of Hadrian's cultural program
points.culturalSignificance: Center of learning in Roman Athens
points.historicalNarrative: Transformed from library to church to mosque over centuries
